GDImageDraw Class Reference

Class for drawing images in memory and saving it into memory in known image formats. More...

#include <GDImageDraw.h>

Detailed Description

Class for drawing images in memory and saving it into memory in known image formats.

Definition at line 54 of file GDImageDraw.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

GDImageDraw::GDImageDraw (  uint32  xSize,
uint32  ySize,
GDUtils::Color::CoolColor  color = static_cast< GDUtils::Color::CoolColor >(0x89A1B7)
) 
 

Constructs a new Image with the desired dimensions.

Parameters:
xSize The number of pixels in the x-dimension.
ySize The number of pixels in the y-dimension.
color Background color of the image. Default set to light blue.

GDImageDraw::~GDImageDraw (   ) 
 

Destructor, deallocates image.

virtual void GDImageDraw::drawArc (  int  cx,
int  cy,
int  startAngle,
int  stopAngle,
int  innerRadius,
int  outerRadius,
GDUtils::Color::CoolColor  color,
int  lineWidth = 1
)  [virtual]
 

Draws an arc, usually a positioned area.

Parameters:
cx Center of arc x-value, may be negative of larger than images x-size.
cx Center of arc y-value, may be negative of larger than images y-size.
startAngle The start angle in degrees.
stopAngle The stop angle in degrees.
outerRaduis The outer radius.
innerRaduis The inner radius, may be 0.
color The color to draw with.
lineWidth The linewidth to draw, default 1.

Implements ImageDraw.

void GDImageDraw::drawGfxFeatureRoadSign (  const char *  name,
const char *  signName,
int32  lat,
int32  lon,
float32  border = 0.10,
double  fontSize = 10.0,
GDUtils::Color::CoolColor  signColor = static_cast< GDUtils::Color::CoolColor >(0xFFFFFF),
const char *  fontName = "Vera.ttf"
)  [virtual]
 

Makes a roadsign at a given position in the bbox.

Parameters:
name The text to draw.
signName The name of the file to draw, including path.
lat The latitude of the sign.
lon The longitude of the sign.
border The frame around the text in the image.
fontSize The initial fontSize to start testing with.
signcolor The color of the text, default WHITE.
fontName The name of the font to use, default "Vera.ttf".

Implements ImageDraw.

void GDImageDraw::drawGfxFeatureText (  const char *  text,
const char *  altText,
int32  lat,
int32  lon,
double  fontSize = 10.0,
GDUtils::Color::CoolColor  color = static_cast< GDUtils::Color::CoolColor >(0x000000),
double  angle = 0.0,
bool  moveText = false,
const char *  fontName = "Vera.ttf"
)  [virtual]
 

Write a text at a given position in the bbox.

Parameters:
text The text to draw.
altLangText The text to draw in alternative language (often english).Drawn below the main text if main text is on one line.
x The x-coordinate of the lower left corner of the text.
y The y-coordinate of the lower left corner of the text.
fontSize The size of the text to draw, default 10.0.
color The color of the text, default BLACK.
angle The angle of the text, default 0.0(right).
splitText If you want to write the text on two lines the text is long.
fontName The name of the font to use,

radius Optional parameter that is the radius of the point.

Implements ImageDraw.

virtual void GDImageDraw::drawRouteAsArrow (  vector< POINT >  route,
vector< POINT >  arrowHead,
GDUtils::Color::CoolColor  color,
uint32  routeWidth
)  [virtual]
 

Draw the route as an arrow.

The arrow head is drawn at the final point in route. All coordinates should be screen/image coordinates.

Parameters:
route Vector containing the points forming the route. These points should end at a distance from the edge making it possible to draw the arrow head.
arrowHead Vector containing the points forming the arrow head. Exactly three points should be contained in the vector, ordered: left corner, top, right corner.
color The color used for drawing the whole arrow, including both the route and the arrow head.
routeWidth The width used when drawingthe route part of the arrow.

Implements ImageDraw.

virtual void GDImageDraw::drawScale (  MC2BoundingBox *  bbox,
StringTable::languageCode  lang = StringTable::ENGLISH
)  [virtual]
 

Draws an scale.

Parameters:
bbox The boundingbox for the image.
lang The language of the scale, default English.

void GDImageDraw::drawSymbol (  DrawSettings::symbol_t  t,
int  x,
int  y,
DrawSettings *  settings,
const GfxFeature *  feature,
ImageTable::ImageSet  imageSet
)  [private]
 

Draw a symbol on the image.

E.g. the car at route origin or the flag at the destination.

Parameters:
t The type of the symbol as defined in the DrawSettings.
x The x-cooridinate for the center of the symbol.
y The y-cooridinate for the center of the symbol.
settings The DrawSettings used to determine the POI type.
feature The GfxFeature.
imageSet The image set to use.

virtual void GDImageDraw::drawTurnArrow (  int  x0,
int  y0,
int  x1,
int  y1,
int  x2,
int  y2,
int  x3,
int  y3,
int  arrowX0,
int  arrowY0,
int  arrowX1,
int  arrowY1,
int  arrowX2,
int  arrowY2,
int32  arrowAngle,
int32  arrowLengh,
GDUtils::Color::CoolColor  col,
int  arrowWidth = 1
)  [virtual]
 

Draw a spline turn arrow using four spline controlpoints and and an arrow.

The arrow is drawn either using the three arrow points or the arrowAngle and arrowLength parameters. It is up to the subclass to deside.

Parameters:
x0 The x value of the first controlpoint.
y0 The y value of the first controlpoint.
x1 The x value of the second controlpoint.
y1 The y value of the second controlpoint.
x2 The x value of the third controlpoint.
y2 The y value of the third controlpoint.
x3 The x value of the fourth controlpoint.
y3 The y value of the fourth controlpoint.
arrowX0 The x value of the left arrowpoint.
arrowY0 The y value of the left arrowpoint.
arrowX1 The x value of the center arrowpoint.
arrowY1 The y value of the center arrowpoint.
arrowX2 The x value of the right arrowpoint.
arrowY2 The y value of the right arrowpoint.
arrowAngle The alternative to using the arrow points is to use this as the angle of the arrow.
arrowLength The alternative to using the arrow points is to use this as the length of the arrow.
col The color to draw the turn arrow with.
arrowWidth The width of the arrows line. Default 1.

Implements ImageDraw.

gdImagePtr GDImageDraw::getBrush (  int  width,
int  red,
int  green,
int  blue
)  [static, private]

void GDImageDraw::getFontPath (  char *  font,
const char *  fontName = "Vera.ttf"
)  [static, private]
 

Makes a path to a font.

Parameters:
font Resulting path is printed into this string.
fontName The font to use.

bool GDImageDraw::getGlyphDimensions (  int  fontSize,
const char *  fontName,
const char *  text,
vector< GfxDataTypes::dimensions > &  dimensions,
float64  xFactor = 1.0,
float64  yFactor = 1.0
)  [virtual]
 

Get the dimensions of the glyphs of the specified font/fontSize and text.

Unless xFactor/yFactor is supplied, the dimension vector will keep the width and height in pixels of each glyph in the text. dimension[i] will correspond to the dimensions of the glyph at position i in text.

Parameters:
fontSize The number of points of the font.
fontName The name of the font.
text The text.
dimensions Out parameter. Vector of dimension structs, where dimensions[i] corresponds to the width and height of glyph text[i] ( i < strlen(text)).
xFactor Optional paramater. Factor to multiply the width dimensions with.
yFactor Optional paramater. Factor to multiply the height dimensions with.
Returns:
True if the fonts and glyphs could be accessed succesfully, false otherwise.

Implements ImageDraw.

virtual byte* GDImageDraw::getImageAsBuffer (  uint32 &  size,
ImageDrawConfig::imageFormat  format = ImageDrawConfig::PNG
)  [virtual]
 

Returns the image as a buffer of the right format.

Parameters:
size Set to the length of the retuned buffer.
format The type of encoding of the buffer.

Implements ImageDraw.

void GDImageDraw::initializeDrawImages (   )  [static]
 

Initializes the static images, used when drawing features that are represented by an image.

This will be called when a new object is created, but will return emediately every time except for the first call. The static member m_imagesInitialized is used to ensure this.

See also:
removeDrawImages.

FT_Face GDImageDraw::loadFace (  const char *  fontName,
bool  useCache = true
)  [static, private]
 

Loads a face (A face object contains all the instance and glyph independent data of a font file typeface).

Parameters:
fontName Name of the face. Excluding path.
useCache If the face cache should be used when retreiving and to store the face, default true.
Returns:
New face or NULL if error. If useCache then the image is stored in the cache and shouldn't be deallocated.

gdImagePtr GDImageDraw::loadImage (  const char *  fileName,
bool  useCache = true,
bool  useImagePath = true
)  [static, private]
 

Loads an image and checks transparensy.

NB! File must be PNG!

Parameters:
fileName The file of the image.
useCache If the image cache should be used when retreiving and to store the image, default true.
useImagePath If the imagepath in the properties should be used, defult true.
Returns:
New image or NULL if error. If useCache then the image is stored in the cache and shouldn't be deallocated.

gdImagePtr GDImageDraw::makeRoadSign (  gdImagePtr  sign,
const char *  signText,
int  x,
int  y,
int  width,
int  height,
GDUtils::Color::CoolColor  color,
float32  fontSize,
const char *  fontName
)  [static, private]
 

Make a new image with the signText on it.

Parameters:
sign The background image to draw text on.
signText The text to draw.
x The x value of the upper left corner of the drawable area.
y The y value of the upper left corner of the drawable area.
width The width of the drawable area.
height The height of the drawable area.
color The color of the text.
fontSize The initial fontSize to start testing with.
fontName The name of the font to use.

virtual void GDImageDraw::transferPixels (  void *  image  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Transfers the pixels from the image to the ImageMagick image.

This implementation tries to be better than the default one.

Parameters:
image The ImageMagick image to set pixels in.

Reimplemented from ImageDraw.

void GDImageDraw::writeText (  const char *  text,
int  x,
int  y,
double  fontSize = 10.0,
GDUtils::Color::CoolColor  color = static_cast< GDUtils::Color::CoolColor >(0x000000),
double  angle = 0.0,
const char *  fontName = "Vera.ttf"
)  [virtual]
 

Write a text at a given position in the image.

Parameters:
text The text to draw.
x The x-coordinate of the lower left corner of the text.
y The y-coordinate of the lower left corner of the text.
fontSize The size of the text to draw, default 10.0.
color The color of the text, default BLACK.
angle The angle of the text, default 0.0(right).
fontName The name of the font to use, default "Vera.ttf".

Implements ImageDraw.
